main event: On November 5, 1957 in Kansas City, Missouri, a civilian reported observing a round object with a blue tail that seemed to glow. The object was white and moved slowly back and forth, up and down, emitting no sound. It was seen in the southwest and subsequently faded behind clouds.
interesting points: The object was described as round, white, and emitting a blue tail that seemed to glow when it flashed off.
No sound was reported as the object moved slowly and erratically in the sky.
The observer mentioned thinking about Sputnik before noticing the object, indicating a heightened awareness of space-related events at the time.
It was observed that the object appeared to hang in the sky and seemed to dance when the observer concentrated on it.
The conclusion categorized the sighting as 'Unknown' due to insufficiency of data for evaluation.
sighted object: round object with a blue tail
